job_description:
Innovar Group is looking for a Lead Software Engineer in Broomfield, CO


CLICK APPLY NOW TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THIS JOB

Innovar Group has partnered with the leader in data analytics to recruit a team of developers focused on revolutionizing the future of machine learning and artificial intelligence software. Be a part of a rapidly growing, fast-paced, team that operates like an innovative start-up with the resources of an established market leader.
Job Type: SW Quality Assurance

Experience: Direct Hire

Salary: N/A

About Us: We Open Doors to Great Opportunities

Innovar Group is comprised of senior talent agents who deliver top recruitment services to clients throughout the United States. We bring a new era of recruiting to the industry by aligning state-of-the-art technology with outstanding talent.

Innovar - derived from the Latin “to innovate” - this is what we set out to do each and every day. We strive to go beyond the norm to utilize innovative next-gen recruiting tools connecting us to the world at large in order to uncover high-impact TECHNOLOGY talent for our valued clients. Our goal is straightforward: the unmitigated satisfaction of each client. The difference is significant; we provide consummate service and foster long-term, thriving relationships with our clients. In essence, we work as a vital member of your talent acquisition team.

Keywords: Perks / Teamwork / Planning / Organization / Create / Analysis / Experience / Software Development / Leadership / Knowledge /
job_description_requirements: Experience: Direct Hire.  Experience / Software Development / Leadership /

job_description:
Remote
Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
You will be responsible for supporting our customers located on the West Coast, and so working West Coast hours is something you are comfortable with.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

Strong computer skills.  Excellent time management and decision-making skills

job_description:
We’re looking for a highly organized Administrative Assistant to support 4-6 key members of our senior leadership team at OpenAI. You’ll be responsible for the leadership team’s calendars, and provide occasional other operational support as needed. You will act as the administrative engine that keeps this group’s meeting schedule organized and on task. You'll need to apply your diplomacy, discretion, and good judgment as you work across various teams and competing priorities.

Our leadership team reflects OpenAI’s culture and core values, and are a group of mission-driven, kind, and thoughtful individuals. We take pride in evolving a work environment that fosters collaboration, open communication, and authenticity, and offer an annual professional development stipend, an internal mentorship program, and regular leadership development workshops.
Your primary responsibilities:
Coordinate meetings and clear conflicts for members of our senior leadership team, including our Head of Applied AI & Partnerships, VP of Research, VP of Engineering, and CFO with occasional support for additional leaders over time.
Ensure critical meetings aren’t missed or delayed and are prioritized accordingly.
Manage and track expense reports for this group using Expensify.
Occasionally organize and manage travel accommodations and out-of-office meetings for members of this group, and perform other administrative tasks as needed.
Partner with our Executive Assistant to the CEO for broad planning and scheduling needs.
Partner with our internal recruiting team to coordinate interviews for these senior leaders and help to ensure they provide prompt interview feedback.
Work with our Operations team to gather input and calendar availability for various events (happy hours, summer picnic, team offsites, meetups, tech talks, etc.).
Your experience includes:
3-5 years of experience in an administrative or support function.
You've worked with technical teams and supported multiple leaders in the past.
You’ve worked in a startup or similar environment.
You've managed and optimized extremely busy calendars.
You're fluent in Google Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Gmail, etc. and other modern productivity software, and are excited to learn and use new tools.
You may be a good match for this role if:
You are supremely detail-oriented. No comma out of place, misspelling, or absent time zone escapes your eye.
You enjoy supporting and empowering others, especially leaders.
You can balance multiple competing priorities and resolve problems, often under time pressure.
You possess exemplary communication skills, both written and verbal.
Are supremely discrete and exercise excellent judgment in all cases.
You embrace the process of adapting to new and changing situations and are receptive to adjusting course as needed.
You are proactive, self-motivated, and communicative about your needs.
About OpenAI
We’re building safe Artificial General Intelligence (AGI), and ensuring it leads to a good outcome for humans. We believe that unreasonably great results are best delivered by a highly creative group working in concert. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Benefits
Health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
Unlimited time off (we encourage 4+ weeks per year)
Parental leave
Flexible work hours
Lunch and dinner each day
401(k) plan
job_description_requirements: Your experience includes:.  3-5 years of experience in an administrative or support function

job_description:
At DistributionNOW, we believe our associates are the best in the business. We value and reward hardworking, creative, and dedicated employees that desire to be part of a team committed to outstanding customer service.
START YOUR CAREER NOW.
As DNOW rapidly pursues next frontier technology through its DigitalNOW platform; we seek a forward thinking and innovative Digital orientated leader to direct our eCommerce execution.

As a key strategic component of our Unified Commerce platform, eCommerce will form the backbone of our go to market customer facing approach. A significant key to success will involve focus on ease of use in addition to the integration of best of breed PIM, Marketplace and Personalization tools with our dynamic, flexible and scalable customized technology stack.


DNOW views DigitalNOW as the market disruptor and aims to transition our industry with aggressive, value driven generators that force multiplies our business proposition to our customers, employees and shareholders. Our eCommerce platform will dramatically alter the competitive landscape and how we approach the market, including, but not limited to, the following game changers:


1. Define product go-to-market strategy, coordinating market research, developing and delivering long-term strategy, marketing plan and sales forecasting, as well as champion market research analysis.

2. Enhanced supplier and customer product expansion through an advanced marketplace platform that forms an order of magnitude industry shift that enables seamless customer to supplier interaction on our platform.

3. Personalization and Artificial Intelligence based product recommendations for cross and up selling.

4. Superior Content management and attribute enhancement.

5. Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Social Media Optimization (SMO).

6. Table based comprehensive bulk product class selection.

7. Advanced and market sensitive customer facing shopping experience.

8. Express Account management and storefront configuration.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage eCommerce technical and functional team
Lead and Manage Digital Projects and execution through cross-functional teams including sales, operations and marketing
Develops detailed requirements, feature definitions and implementation plans
Execute legacy and long-term eCommerce objectives
Manage customized eCom development ROI and KPI’s
BENEFITS:
Competitive Salary + bonus
401(k)/ Retirement savings
Comprehensive Benefits (medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverage)
Career growth
Friendly work environment
Paid vacation/holidays
job_description_requirements: Advanced and market sensitive customer facing shopping experience

job_description:
About Rev

Rev is the largest and most popular voice-to-text service in the world with more than 170,000 customers globally. Recognized widely as the most accurate and fastest service of its kind, Rev helps anyone capture insights from voice, connect with audiences and turbocharge productivity. Powered by a large and vibrant community of freelancers, Rev uses artificial intelligence tools to turn speech into text at unparalleled low cost. The company is obsessed with making the power of voice accessible to everyone, all while creating fulfilling work-from-home jobs.


About the Position

We are seeking driven, passionate individuals to join our growing Customer Success team. The CS team works exclusively with Rev's premier clients by onboarding, problem-solving, communicating product updates, and demonstrating the value of Rev's platform. You'll be part of a quickly-expanding sales team at a growth-stage startup, and your input will be crucial to the CS org's direction.

As a CSM on our team, you are well-versed in customer success practices and have a genuine passion for working with clients. You're excited about learning new things and helping shape processes, and can work independently without always needing step-by-step instructions. You're adaptable, and embrace the frequent changes that come with working in a start-up environment. If solving a customer's problem or removing a bottleneck sparks joy, this is the place for you.


Responsibilities

Work with clients to understand their challenges, problem-solve, and find ways that Rev can best provide value for their teams
Communicate commonly requested features to the Product team and drive product innovation by advocating client needs
Be the "face of the company" for Rev users, owning the onboarding process and providing account support as needed
Promote customer satisfaction and retention by proactive engagement
Create and run business reviews for a number of named clients
Identify and mitigate churn risks
Provide clients with ongoing updates to the Product roadmap


Minimum Qualifications

Self-starter with desire to work in an agile, fast-paced environment
1-2 years in a customer success role or another customer-facing position
Strong organization and multitasking skills
Great written and verbal communication skills
Working understanding of sales pipelines, processes, and contracts
Creative thinker with an eye for detail
BA/BS or equivalent working experience
job_description_requirements: Strong organization and multitasking skills.  BA/BS or equivalent working experience

job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:

NCI: As a System Administrator, you will have the opportunity assist our team in the support of the US Army, and provide congenial customer service and in-depth technical systems support. This challenging position will require a vast array of technical and communication-skills to support the technical and customer-related activities. Additionally, this position will support a wide variety of other activities from low-level design, to operating system and application support, to various hardware support activities in a fast-paced environment. In assuming this position, you will be a critical contributor to meeting NCI's mission: To deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions and services that enable our customers to rapidly adapt to dynamic environments.

Highlights of Responsibilities:
Monitors data communications network to ensure that network is available to all system users and resolves data communications problems
Receives telephone calls from user with data communications problem such as failure of data to be transmitted to another location
Reviews procedures user followed to determine if specified steps were taken
Explains user procedures necessary to transmit data
Monitors modems and display screens of terminals to mainframe computer to detect error messages that signal malfunction in communications software or hardware
Enters diagnostic commands into computer to determine nature of problem and reads codes on screen to diagnose problem
Attaches diagnostic equipment to phone line to learn if line meets specification
Reads technical reference manuals for communications hardware and software to learn cause of problem
Instructs user to enter specified commands into computer to resolve problem
Calls service technician for service when problem cannot be resolved
Enters operating commands into computer to restart program
Records number of daily data communications transactions and number of problems and actions taken
Updates documentation to record new equipment installed, new sites, and changes to computer configurations
Inspects communications wires and cables
Trains staff and users to use equipment
Coordinates installation of or installs communications lines
Qualifications:
Minimum Requirements:
Active Secret security clearance
Security+ (prior to start).
Certification of MCSA or MCSE or Comptia Server+ or must be able to obtain within 6 months of start date
College Degree or equivalent experience (BS + 5 years, AS + 6, HS + 7)
7-12 years of job related experience

Physical Requirements:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl as required
Repeatedly lift and carry weight up to 25 pounds
Travel by land or air transportation 25%
It is the policy of NCI to provide equal opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting individuals in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected class or category as may be defined by federal, state, or local laws or regulations. In addition, we affirm that all compensation, benefits, company-sponsored training, educational assistance, social, and recreational programs are administered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. It is our firm intent to support equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in keeping with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. NCI is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
job_description_requirements: College Degree or equivalent experience (BS + 5 years, AS + 6, HS + 7).  7-12 years of job related experience

job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. Coupled with a refined focus on strategic partnerships, we are successfully bridging the gap between commercial best practices and mission-critical government processes. Core competencies include:
Artificial intelligence
Agile digital transformation
Advanced analytics
Hyperconverged infrastructure solutions
Cyber security and information assurance
Fraud, waste and abuse
Engineering and logistics
NCI has been designated a 2018 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com

Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, NCI has approximately 2,000 employees operating at more than 100 locations worldwide.
Responsibilities:
As a Program Manager, you are responsible for managing and coordinating multi-discipline product development projects regarding technical feasibility assessment, planning, design optimization, cost/schedule management, risk assessment/mitigation, project communication, and ongoing production support. You apply Agile best practices to collaborate and participate in creating user stories to ensure the delivery of solutions. In assuming this position, you are a vital contributor to meeting NCI's mission: To deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions and services that enable our customers to rapidly adapt to dynamic environments as well as to expand our AI solutions.

 RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversees program budget and schedules
Responsible for managing very complex and/or high-risk technical programs
Manage and track program schedules, technical issues, and negotiate priorities against project plans to ensure key internal and external deliverables are met
Provide effective communication regarding status, issues, objectives, dependencies, risks and plan execution to management, software development teams and customers
Lead and drive internal cross functional teams to meet program deliverables and quality criteria according to program milestones
Support and drive continuous improvement to software development process
Responsibility for program growth
Exercises a high level of independent judgment and initiative in solving highly complex problems
Oversees and develops strategic planning strategy
May assist the Business Development group in the proposal development process
Qualifications:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
U.S Citizenship
Bachelor’s Degree
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification
7+ years leading software development programs
3+ years managing software programs utilizing agile and DevOps
Must have Secret clearance or higher
PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Agile Certification desired

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
It is the policy of NCI to provide equal opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting individuals in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected class or category as may be defined by federal, state, or local laws or regulations. In addition, we affirm that all compensation, benefits, company-sponsored training, educational assistance, social, and recreational programs are administered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. It is our firm intent to support equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in keeping with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. NCI is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
job_description_requirements: Must have Secret clearance or higher

job_description:
**Description**

Pearson is the world’s learning company. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people. Our vision is to have a direct relationship with millions of lifelong learners and to link education to the way people aspire to live and work every day. We believe that we all need to embrace lifelong learning, continuously acquiring new knowledge and skills to thrive in an ever-changing and increasingly connected world.

The AI Products and Solutions team is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Engineering Manager to lead the AI Research Engineering team. We are a cross-functional, interdisciplinary team trying to push the boundaries of what’s possible in education using Artificial Intelligence to positively impact millions of learners around the globe.

The AI Research Engineering team is responsible for all backend work supporting the R&D of AI products, services and prototypes. Our team’s development stack includes tools and technologies like Python, Google Cloud, AWS, GitLab, TensorFlow, SQL, REST APIs, Docker, and Kubernetes.

This is a full-time role located in Denver, CO.

About the role:
+ You are responsible for attracting, mentoring, supporting and retaining a team of top-notch engineers who design, build and support AI services and prototypes.

+ You drive the technical and strategic vision of the team and help translate day-to-day issues into coherent and robust solutions.

+ You collaborate with internal and external (sometimes non-technical) stakeholders and customers throughout the company.

+ You plan and prioritize the team’s road map to foster a culture where innovation can come from anyone anywhere.

**Qualifications**

About you:
+ You have a passion for data, education, the art of engineering and AI-enhanced systems.

+ You have specific experience building and supporting data focused platforms and services as is experience with cloud services.

+ You are unafraid of starting with lots of hacking and iteration to explore the problem space. We would love to hear about your experience in building Proofs of Concept and prototypes, especially those that were scaled to production.

+ You are comfortable translating sometimes ambiguous business problems into plans that our engineers can act on and feel passionate about.

+ You care about facilitating learning and growth on the team - you put our engineers first.

+ You embody Pearson’s dedication to a culture of fairness, and our commitment to equal opportunity, diversity, and inclusiveness.

+ You are thoughtful about all the ways an engineering manager can have an impact.

+ You want to learn, grow yourself, through partnerships with multiple interdisciplinary teams in order to understand their orchestration, scaling and deployment requirements.

What’s next?

Interested in working with us? Send us a cover letter and your CV or resume explaining why you’d be great for the job. We value unique talents and different points of view and would love to hear about something you have done that you’re proud of.

\#LI-TM

job_title_2: Digital – Senior Product Marketing Manager, Cognitive Computing
job_description:
Role/Department Description:
FactSet's Cognitive Computing Team provides services that help clients find alpha and achieve their digital transformations by leveraging artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data science. Our mission is to empower FactSet to reach new markets through smart, differentiated content, innovative services, and flexible methods of access.
The Senior Product Marketing Manager drives the strategy behind the team’s target market plan and is responsible for helping with the development and execution of the annual marketing plans to promote FactSet’s solutions in order to build brand awareness, drive leads, and achieve measurable ROI. The Senior Product Marketing Manager possesses an expert understanding of the FactSet platform, our datasets and related products, our clients and prospects, and the various Marketing techniques to implement that will help achieve the department’s goals.
This person has an exceptional track record of implementing successful campaigns, effectively collaborating across groups, balancing a large budget, and leading by example.
Responsibilities:
Identifies ASV and product opportunities among Cognitive services
Develops Pricing and Packaging strategy for Cognitive products; partners with other Strategic Business Units to identify bundles of products to monetize
Liaises with FactSet’s Marketing team to create Cognitive product focused campaigns (Insight articles and blogs, partner webinars, industry speaking opportunities, social media posts, At-A-Glance, white papers, industry research, press releases, etc.)
Creates collateral for Sales and Consulting (slides, case studies, demo scripts, webinars, etc.) to share FactSet’s AI story and offerings with clients
Collaborates with Cognitive Engineers on client-facing documentation - e.g. OFM Starter Kits, API documentation, OA documentation, use cases, performance summaries
Performs industry, c ompetitor, and client analysis and awareness . Develops a good understanding of client needs and market trends through direct client interaction, market research, and collaboration with User Research
Interfaces with clients and FactSet Sales, and investigates competitive offerings to understand: 1. Clients’ interest in products – e.g. through user groups 2. How clients want to consume Cognitive services or the output of our services 3. Competitors’ related offerings 4. Our product gaps: what we are missing and how we need to improve 5. Develops insights that inform product strategy and roadmap; helps prioritize project backlog based on client interest
Develops a network of “friendly clients” and works with them directly to pilot and provide feedback on beta Cognitive offerings
Assist in evaluating potential AI vendors, partners, and acquisitions with respect to client needs and gaps in our offerings
Required Skills:
7+ years of experience in sales, strategy, product development, or other client-facing role
Understanding of or ability to learn commercial strategies for monetizing APIs, data feeds, etc.
Has a passion and talent for building strong and impactful relationships and internal partnerships
Able to effectively communicate and sell the benefits of Cognitive projects to clients and business partners
FactSet is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

job_title_2: VP Senior BSA Systems Intelligence Manager
정리된 job_title: VP Senior BSA Systems Intelligence Manager
job_description:
Overview:
Drive the maturity of the BSA/AML/Sanctions Program strategy and roadmap which includes identifying and managing innovation initiatives including performing proof-of-concepts, conducting industry research, analyzing vendors and tools. Use knowledge of latest AML innovative risk mitigation methodologies and approaches and industry best practices to recommend future state of the Program and develop a prioritized list of execution plans to transform current systems/processes to target-state.
Responsibilities:
Leads research and analysis of latest industry tools and methods related to the FinTech and RegTech space leveraging concepts including but not limited to artificial intelligence, machine learning, distributed ledger technologies, robotics process automation, big data, graph databases, etc.
Prioritizes initiatives in a logical value-stream with executable plans using an Agile framework to demonstrate value.
Performs vendor/tool proof-of-concepts, vendor/tool analysis, and clearly articulate assessment summaries to leadership.
Leads as the Process Champion and Change Agent to assist the Bank in maturing and transforming the AML program. Effectively articulate the value-driven initiatives and purpose of change across the organization and gain buy-in from all levels of management and workforce.
Leads technology and other stakeholder discussions to decide on the target-state ensuring the platform and architecture is scalable and sustainable to mitigate the Bank’s current AML risks as well as future risks from the anticipated business growth.
Leads discussions to determine the target-state AML processes including by not limited to automating the risk assessment and required monitoring from new program onboarding, implementing rule tuning techniques, deploying segmentation, and enabling dynamic workflows.
Manages the strategic program execution towards achieving the roadmap target-state.
Monitors of the program to identify process improvements and updating the roadmap where applicable. Summarize findings in a clear, concise manner, and communicate results and project progress to senior management.
Presents analysis and summaries to executive and senior management, auditors and examiners. Creates effective presentations and recommendations with supporting evidence to drive program objectives.
Maintains documentation to support regular audits and exams. Assists management in preparing materials required for audits and exams.
Maintains awareness of BSA, OFAC, USA PATRIOT Act and current related regulations, directives, and guidance as it impacts FCRM processes, systems and technology. Participate in external opportunities to gain knowledge of software/platform applications and functionalities aligned with FCRM initiatives.
Develops close working relationships with various departments including operations, advisory, business, and technology.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience Requirements
An undergraduate degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Seven years BSA/AML/OFAC and compliance experience, including seven years testing and validating BSA/AML/OFAC models, seven years tuning and optimizing BSA/AML monitoring and detection systems and seven years in a leadership or management role.
Preferred Requirements
Seven years management consultant experience (preferably from a Big-4).
Seven years defining key risk metrics, dashboards, and analytics for senior management and executive reporting
One year of FinTech tools experience including cross-border AML technology, RPA/Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence toolsets
Knowledge of FinTech/RegTech concepts and trends.
Knowledge of financial math, financial economics and/or statistics, including clustering and factor analysis.
In depth understanding of BSA/AML and OFAC regulatory requirements, technology, and data analysis best practices to guide decision making and execution of AML technology and enterprise wide AML initiatives.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills with the ability to apply defined methodology to monitoring processes.
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently.
Team player able to work effectively in a team fostered, multi-tasking environment (preferably with experience related to Agile-based projects).
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).
Demonstrate ability to appropriately work with confidential information.
Employment with The Bancorp includes successfully passing a background check including credit, criminal, OFAC, education and past employment.

The Bancorp is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

GEF O&M Systems Administrator III - Fort Bragg
Support the Government’s design, development, implementation, operations and maintenance requirements for GEF, supporting NETCOM-wide business processes, automation requirement, and information technology management requirements in all NETCOM managed Army DoDIN sites.
Design, develop, implement, and maintain automation, workflows, documentation, and processes based on Government requirements.
Provide and reinforce security of all assigned systems to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the information and business processes.
Support migrations of systems and applications from one hosting site to another. Such migration activities include support for GEF and NETCOM-wide planning, execution, and tracking. Migration activities may include emerging technologies and platforms that may require extensive planning and execution on both Army and DISA managed networks.
Install new Linux OS releases, configure, upgrade, patch, and secure servers. Install, patch installations, upgrade, and maintain Intel-based system hardware and software.
Maintenance and administration of Microsoft Enterprise products and tools interrelate in order to ensure NetOps capability integration in support of the classified missions on mission networks such as CENTRIXS and SIPRNET networks.

Experience installing, configuring, administering and troubleshooting Citrix (including experience with Metaframe, Presentation Server, and XenApp Citrix versions). Practical knowledge of WAN acceleration technologies such as Riverbed products and hands-on experience with KG-175 and KG-250 series of National Security Agency (NSA) encryptors in classified and coalition networks and working knowledge of management software such as GEM X and ViaSat VINE Manager.
Create, maintain and update documentation; back up, retrieve, maintain, and migrate programs and data.

job_description:
If you specialize in robotic autonomy and have an entrepreneurial spirit, RE2 Robotics has the perfect role for you. The Software Engineer:Trajectory Planning position is open to people who are passionate about developing the next generation of autonomous robotic arms. Working with a team of engineers, this specialized software engineer will lead the development of autonomous manipulator trajectories to complete tasks for both commercial and defense customers.
RE2 Robotics has become a leading developer of mobile manipulation by working closely with universities, research institutes, and the federal government to create human-like robotic solutions that are strong, lightweight, compact, power efficient, and rugged. Through our research, we have developed robotic arms that are highly dexterous and easily controlled. In our vision, the next horizon to mobile manipulation is the addition of greater autonomy so that our systems can run with less supervision and in environments with highly limited bandwidth. The person filling this SE role will help us turn this vision into a reality.
Position Requirements
M.S. or B.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or related field
Demonstrated experience in artificial intelligence and/or motion planning
Must be U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Responsibilities and Duties
The Software Engineer: Trajectory Planning will be responsible for developing algorithms to plan manipulator trajectories for use in a variety of products and projects. This position requires someone who can learn, develop, dream up and apply novel techniques for problems focused on controlling robotic manipulators.
Lead the development of solutions in the areas of trajectory planning for robotic systems.
Work closely with mechanical, electrical, and software engineering teams to develop systems from concept to production level.
Develop and execute autonomous manipulation projects including guiding the technical approach and managing the development of the system.
Benefits and Perks
RE2 offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including maternity/paternity leave, flexible schedules, half-day Fridays, stock options, 401k plan, training and professional development stipends, paid time off, and medical/dental/vision/life and disability insurance for all regular full-time employees.
RE2 also offers our monthly Taco Tuesday lunches, free snacks, coffee, and espresso, weekly fresh fruit delivery, holiday and summer parties, birthday bonuses, cell phone stipend, and more!
RE2 is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. We believe there is great value in having a diverse workforce and we take pride in being an inclusive and accepting work environment for all people.
RESUMES ACCEPTED IN PDF FORMAT ONLY.
Keywords
GIT, Linux, ROS, C / C++, Python, Trajectory Planning, Grasp Planning, Inverse Kinematics, Forward Kinematics

job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI: As the Network Administrator Senior you will support the Global Enterprise Fabric (GEF) Operations and Maintenance contract. GEF falls under NETCOM Army Enterprise’s DoDIN operations and services provider, executing full-spectrum cyber operations and attaining information superiority, and achieving an integrated network enterprise across the Joint, Interagency, Intergovernmental, and Multinational (JIIM) domains. NETCOM plans, engineers, installs, integrates, operates, protects, and sustains Army Cyberspace, enabling Mission Command through all phases of unified action operations with all mission partners across the JIIM domains. NETCOM is the single authority assigned to operate, manage, and defend the Army’s “InfoStructure” at the enterprise level and the single authority for any standard, system, architecture, design, or device that impacts the Army Enterprise Infostructure. NCI will support all NETCOM managed Army DoDIN enclaves including NIPR, SIPR, Coalition Network Combined Enterprise Regional Information Exchange System (CENTRIX) –Korea (CX-K), Mobilization and Force Generation Installation (MFGI) Mission Partner Environment (MPE), and tactical network integrations. NCI will provide services defined in the contract, including capability management, project integration, process development, Information Assurance (IA), cybersecurity, configuration management (CM), hardware/software support, as well as support functions such as database policy definition, requirements development and management and technical writing.
Network Administrator Senior
Provide systems integration services to assist in drafting, submitting, and reviewing engineering change packages, and government approved changes to incorporate the use of unit acquired MNAKs to facilitate scalability for mission networks.
Provide Virtual Storage System (VSS) integration services to provide Tier I/II support for backup and recovery capabilities to enable COOP/DR support for Army units, application owners, and RCCs using MNAK and VSS services to facilitate scalability for mission networks.
Provide VSS integration services to assist drafting, submitting, and reviewing change packages that effect changes in the Mission Networks supported.
Provide VSS integration services to assist in drafting, submitting, and reviewing change packages to allow additional mission networks to extend their capabilities from VSS to assigned Army units equipped with MNAKs to facilitate scalability for mission networks. Adhere to NSA policies on the reutilization of VSS and associated network and storage equipment to support a new mission network.
Provide VSS services to draft, submit, and review monthly Continuity Management reports and Continuity Requirements Estimates.
Provide VSS services to analyze problem reports from all DoD network operations and security centers related to the operations and maintenance activities.
Prepare, develop and analyze configurations of the VSS. Develop a Tier I/II support plan for the MNAK and all network supporting components.
Provide support for the CM process in support of routine patching, synchronization with AGM and day-to-day operational issues of the software, hardware, and storage of the network infrastructure.
Maintain and update system baseline and applicable system changes for input into the Enterprise Configuration Management Data Base (CMDB).
Provide Tier I/II support, which includes coordination with other vendors’ products specialists.
Document processes for identifying and resolving faults, deficiencies, and other problems.
Support the Government in developing methods to validate resolutions and support operational environments and utilize the lab environment to minimize situational impacts on the end-user/customer.
Analyze and test DISA-released capabilities for technology insertion into the Army enterprise and provide the Government with the test report findings and recommendations.
Provide technical support documentation for the deployment, operational testing, technical refresh, integration, interoperability, analysis and documentation of hardware/software of NETCOM Enterprise fielded capabilities to include Ports, Protocols and Services (PPS) system design capabilities throughout the Enterprise construct.
Install, configure, and analyze applicable software in a test environment, and provide test results.
Identify, analyze, and test new technologies, feature sets, applications, updates, and capabilities to allow effective integration and interoperability within the LWN/Army DoDIN for Government approval to meet suspense dates.
Analyze, diagnose, and recommend solutions to complex systems problems. Provide technical advice and assistance to assigned projects and suggest efficient approaches and methods to resolve problems.
Coordinate, prepare and deliver technical informal over-the-shoulder training to the technical staff.
Develop draft implementation guidance, best practice information, and detailed product feature specifications to support integration into the LWN/Army DoDIN.
Qualifications:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience: BA 10 - 15 years

Clearance: Secret

IA Certification: IAT-II (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, CND, SSCP)

CE Certification: CCNA or MCSA or VCP or equivalent

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl as required
Travel by land or air transportation 10%

Responsibilities:
As a Development Lead (Senior Developer), you will be developing and designing front end web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of applications, and working alongside graphic designers for web design features, among other duties. You need to be proficient in both front and back end coding and perform tasks using Agile methodologies participating in creating user stories for business functionality, technical requirements, and defining acceptance criteria. You are required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring collaboration, excellent organizational skills, and attention to detail. In assuming this position, you are a vital contributor to meeting NCI's mission: To deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions and services that enable our customers to rapidly adapt to dynamic environments as well as to expand our AI solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop application software solutions using Java, and JavaScript-based frameworks like Angular, and Spring Boot.
Develop secure REST and SOAP web services using Java Spring and Java Security
Ensure high-quality code by creating and maintaining a high percentage of unit and integration test cases.
Support frequent iterations of code deployments using mature Agile DevSecOps processes and an established CI/CD pipeline in a cloud environment.
Implement and maintain Docker configuration files to deploy microservices as shippable containers.
Query, cleanse, and migrate data between legacy and modernized data sources using open source technologies.
Analyze, query, and manage data in PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases.
Ensure application accessibility and 508 compliance using tools such as WAVE, AMP, and JAWS.
Create and update the required documentation, such as the System Design Document (SDD) and Interface Control Document (ICD).
Write and execute load test scripts.
Troubleshoot system issues related to software applications.
Contribute to Agile ceremonies/meetings, including providing demonstrations of code and contributing to the Agile team wherever required.
Work alongside graphic designers for web design features.
Seek through a project from conception to finished product.
Meet both technical and consumer needs.
Stay abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.

U.S. citizenship.
Must have Secret clearance or higher.
Possess bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
7+ years in C++, Java, JavaScript, database, REST/SOAP/Web Services, Network Performance/Resilience, and Tomcat
5+ years leading software development teams
5+ years in Agile software development and DevOps
5+ years in performing end-to-end software application development and software application management (Front End, Middle Tier, Back End, Storage, and Integration Points)

job_description:
ECS is seeking a Technical Project Manager to work in our Fairfax, VA office.
Job Description:
ECS is seeking a Technical Project Manager to support the development and integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into autonomous aerial vehicle prototypes for the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center.
We are a rapidly growing company that considers our employees to be our most important asset. People truly are number one at ECS. We are situated in Fairfax, VA - well positioned for most commutes in the Northern Virginia area. Our newly renovated office spaces are first class and provide an inspirational environment. We offer opportunities for telework and have some of the most interesting advanced IT business in the DC area. ECS has extraordinary customers who are thought and action leaders in the AI/ML field. We offer highly competitive compensation and benefits to the right person for this key position.

ECS is seeking a technically skilled Technical Project Manager to manage and provide direction for a research and development Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) and autonomous unmanned aerial system project supporting the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center (JAIC). This project will entail the supervision of a complex environment of subcontract developers, Government partners, and customers working together to develop, test, and deliver a multi-sensor fusion & AI-processing software at the edge aboard a UAS. This role will entail the management of the creation of the DoD’s first high fidelity enterprise modeling and simulation environment for autonomous single and multi-platform UAS’s. The candidate will work closely with stakeholders to include the DoD and its partners, commercial AI vendors, and traditional federal contractors to translate customer requirements into formal agreements and plans that meet the customer's mission needs. The candidate will work with the customer to identify their objectives and develop a proposed solution. The candidate will lead a highly technical team in initiating, planning, controlling, and executing initiatives in support of sensitive and critical Joint Artificial Intelligence Center priorities.
Required Skills:
Must have a Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field
Must be a US Citizen
Must possess an Active Secret Clearance and the ability to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance with SCI
10+ years of management experience; prior technical project management experience required.
Experience leading technical and non-technical teams in the many components of project management such as: financial management, program documentation, scheduling, deployment, customer service, quality control, and others.
UAS (MQ-1/MQ-9) Operations and program management experience.
Experience working with the US Air Force unmanned aerial system programs of record.
Experience or familiarity with AI/ML.
Experience or familiarity with autonomous vehicle development and testing.
Experience in detailed technical requirements gathering, interpretation, analysis, and validation.
Experience in project planning, scheduling, and preparing detailed products regarding program status.
Experience managing subcontractors; managing multiple, diverse, and non-traditional subcontractors is a plus.
Ability to effectively communicate and share knowledge with contacts at all level, both technical and non-technical.
Knowledge of sensor imaging systems and products and familiarity with AI/ML learning applications, integration, and testing/evaluation standards.
Experience working with multiple stakeholders in the customer space and managing competing priorities.
Requires the ability to operate in a fluid, high operational tempo environment.
Must demonstrate flexibility and the ability to change directions rapidly when required.
Must be a self-starter with the ability to recognize client and team needs.

Desired Skills:
Top Secret Clearance
Master’s Degree highly preferred in technical area or business/project management
Program leadership experience in MQ-9 design, production, and/or operations
Experience managing or participating in MQ-9 operations to include developmental test and evaluation (DT&E).
PMP Certification
Experience working with cloud technologies (Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.)
Experience working with Department of Defense (DoD) organizations or performers
Familiarity with intelligence community collection and exploitation techniques

ECS is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. ECS promotes affirmative action for minorities, women, disabled persons, and veterans.
ECS is a leading mid-sized provider of technology services to the United States Federal Government. We are focused on people, values and purpose. Every day, our 3000+ employees focus on providing their technical talent to support the Federal Agencies and Departments of the US Government to serve, protect and defend the American People.

job_title_2: Associate Director, Data Scientist- NLP & Text Mining
job_description:
It’s Time For A Change… Your Future Evolves Here

Evolent Health has a bold mission to change the health of the nation by changing the way health care is delivered. Our pursuit of this mission is the driving force that brings us to work each day. We believe in embracing new ideas, challenging ourselves and failing forward. We respect and celebrate individual talents and team wins. We have fun while working hard and Evolenteers often make a difference in everything from scrubs to jeans.

Are we growing? Absolutely—about 50% growth from 2015 through late 2019. Are we recognized? Definitely. Evolent was the first organization ever to receive NCQA’s Population Health Program Accreditation, and is consistently recognized as one of the Becker’s Healthcare 150 Top Places to Work. We recognize employees that live our values, give back to our communities each year, and are champions for bringing our whole selves to work each day. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it.
This position is for the Chicago location.

What You’ll Be Doing:

The Associate Director Data Scientist will support building of AI products in Agile fashion that empower healthcare payers, providers and members to quickly process medical data to making informed decisions and overall reduce health care costs. As a research scientist/engineer part of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence team you will be working primarily on unstructured text data to build machine learning models for information retrieval applications. These applications include but are not limited to optical character recognition, understanding the contents of the medical documents using natural language processing, and integrating processes into the overall AI pipeline to mine healthcare and medical information with high recall and other relevant metrics. We ingest claims, medical charts, etc. from providers containing unstructured data which will be transformed into structured data to support automated entry into our storage layers for downstream applications. The results will be used dually for real-time operational processes with both automated and human-based decision making as well as contribute to reducing healthcare administrative costs. We work with all major cloud and big data vendors offerings including but not limited to (Azure, AWS, Google, IBM, etc.) to achieve AI goals in healthcare and support Evolent business.
The Sr. Scientist will have the opportunity to build a team, shape team culture and operating norms as a result of the fast-paced nature of a new, high-growth organization.
Develop Natural Language Medical/Healthcare documents comprehension related products to support Evolent Health business objectives, products and improve processing efficiency, reducing overall healthcare costs
Gather external data sets; build synthetic data and label data sets as per the needs for NLP/NLR/NLU
Apply expert software engineering skills to build Natural Language products to improve automation and improve user experiences leveraging unstructured data storage, Entity Recognition, POS Tagging, ontologies, taxonomies, data mining, information retrieval techniques, machine learning approach, distributed and cloud computing platforms
Own the Natural Language and Text Mining products — from platforms to systems for model training, versioning, deploying, storage and testing models with creating real time feedback loops to fully automated services
Work closely and collaborate with Data Scientists, Machine Learning engineers, IT teams and Business stakeholders spread out across various locations in US and India to achieve business goals
Provide mentoring to other Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineers

The Experience You’ll Need (Required):
MS degree or above in Computer Science, Computational linguistics, Mathematics, Physics or related STEM fields
5+ years of Industry experience related to Unstructured Text Data and NLP (PhD work and internships will be considered if they are related to unstructured text in lieu of industry experience)
Strong understanding of mathematical concepts including but not limited to linear algebra, Advanced calculus, partial differential equations and statistics including Bayesian approaches
Strong programming experience including understanding of concepts in data structures, algorithms, compression techniques, high performance computing, distributed computing, and various computer architecture
Good understanding and experience with traditional data science approaches like sampling techniques, feature engineering, classification and regressions, SVM, trees, model evaluations
Additional course work, projects, research participation and/or publications in Natural Language processing, reasoning and understanding, information retrieval, text mining, search, computational linguistics, ontologies, semantics
Experience with developing and deploying products in production with experience in two or more of the following languages (Python, C++, Java, Scala)
Strong Unix/Linux background and experience with at least one of the following cloud vendors like AWS, Azure, and Google
Hands on experience with one or more of high-performance computing and distributed computing like Spark, Dask, Hadoop, CUDA distributed GPU
Thorough understanding of deep learning architectures and hands on experience with one or more frameworks like tensorflow, pytorch, keras
Hands on experience with libraries and tools like Spacy, NLTK, Stanford core NLP Genism, johnsnowlabs

Finishing Touches (Preferred):
A PhD degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computational Linguistics, Machine Learning, or related technical field
Exposure to linguistic background especially language models
Medical concepts with codes from standard ontologies (SNOMED CT, LOINC, RxNorm, ICD, etc.)
Lucene, Solr, Elastic Search experience
Experience with Kubernetes and dockers
Experience building REST API’s for AI work and knowledge of microservices architecture
Experience managing a team of offshore developers

Evolent Health is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

job_description:
La Jolla Logic (LJL) is an advanced technology and information system security solutions firm founded in 2011 in San Diego, CA. LJL's mission is to pioneer innovative, high-quality and best value specialty technology and engineering services to customers in the federal government and commercial marketplace.
We are an SBA Certified 8(a) Woman-Owned Small Business, awarded San Diego’s WOSB of the Year 2019 by the US SBA, and the SBA District Director’s Technology Sector Award in 2018. LJL has a reputation for performance to the highest standard, specializing in high-end cybersecurity engineering solutions, to include Machine Learning Technology, Artificial Intelligence R&D, Secure Enterprise Architecture Design, Cross Domain Solutions (CDS) , DoD Cloud Architecture development and deployment (AWS, Azure), Structured Data Models and Inference Engine Technology, System Security Engineering and System Accreditations (RMF & DIACAP), Advanced Technology Concept Development and Feasibility Assessments, Information Systems Security Manager/Officer (ISSM/ISSO) Services, and NIST 800-171 Compliance.
We are looking for a Full-Time Project Manager (Mid) to join our growing team to support Navy’s Next Generation Enterprise Networks newly awarded contract (NGEN-R) to provide Service Management, Integration and Transport (SMIT). The effort involves digital modernization of the Navy and Marine Corps enterprise networks for the next 8 years! Multiple locations across CONUS available.
Responsibilities may include:
Plan, direct, and coordinate team activities to manage and implement project and interrelated projects from initiation to final operational stage.
Determine, monitor, and review all project economics to include costs, operational budgets, staffing requirements, resources, and risk.
Lead the project team in determining client requirements and translating requirements into operational plans.
Identify and assemble the appropriate blend of resources to meet project needs and requirements.
Manage sub-contractors.
Plan, schedule, monitor, and report on activities related to the project.
Develop project control and reporting procedures and manage changes in operational plan.
Undertake status review meetings among project team members and clients.
Work with management on project proposals, bids, contracts, estimates, and schedules.
Coach and advise team members to accomplish project goals, to meet established schedules, and resolve technical or operational issues.
Proactively influence customers to apply project planning methodologies.
Ensure adherence to legally binding requirements.
Control project requirements, scope, and change management issues.
Establish appropriate metrics for measuring key project criteria.
Install appropriate automated systems for management of projects.
Develop, propose, and negotiate project proposals, quotations, and add-ons to leadership and the client.
Analyze needs and recommend appropriate planning concepts and tools to be used for all facets of planning, scheduling, and tracking projects.
Analyze project progress/costs and facilitates the development of recommended alternatives. Integrate and use project management methodologies.
Create communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.
Advise senior management on project management capability and risk.
Maintain awareness on emerging technologies and project management techniques.

QUALIFICATIONS:
The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:
Minimum of four (4) years experience
Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business, or related field
Active Secret Clearance at minimum
U.S. Citizenship is required

For more information about us, please visit our webpage at:
www.lajollalogic.com
La Jolla Logic is an Equal Opportunity Employer
job_description_requirements: Minimum of four (4) years experience.  Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business, or related field

job_description:
**Remote-based Role; MUST CURRENTLY RESIDE IN TEXAS OR WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED.
Technical Cloud Project Manager
ClearScale is a leading cloud systems integration company and AWS Premier Consulting Partner. We provide a wide range of cloud services including Migrations, Application Modernization, DevOps, Data & Analytics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, IoT, Managed Cloud and Cloud Strategy. Our team has been working remote for the past 10 years supporting our clients. Since 2011, our expert team has helped Fortune 500 enterprises, mid-market businesses, SMBs, and startups in all major vertical markets succeed with ambitious, challenging, and unique cloud projects. We architect, develop, and launch innovative and sophisticated solutions using the latest cutting-edge cloud technologies.
ClearScale is growing quickly due to high demand for the services we provide. Public cloud is one of the fastest growing markets in the technology industry, with Gartner forecasting a $226 billion market - nearly 20% YoY revenue growth for public cloud services in 2020. With AWS as the recognized leader in public cloud, our status as one of the select few AWS Premier Consulting Partners positions us for sustained success.
This is a unique opportunity to make a big impact, enjoy competitive compensation, manage a wide variety of projects for clients across multiple industries, and work alongside some of the best minds in the cloud services industry.
Job Summary:
The Technical Cloud Project Manager works directly with external clients managing multiple projects simultaneously. The PM's responsibilities start from the moment a project is signed and proceed until the engagement is successfully completed. The position leads clients to a successful outcome through process, resource management and financial tracking.
Manages client engagements from kickoff to delivery
Monitors project dates, tasks, hours spent, risks, blockers and customer satisfaction throughout the project life cycle
Identifies scope changes from the original plan or agreement and escalates to the management team
Works directly with Tech Leads and Directors to ensure project success
Facilitates meetings and other communication, including status reporting and meeting notes
Manages customer expectations and meets clients face to face as needed
Seeks process improvements
Reviews project hours reports for accuracy
Does not manage personnel
Does not perform any "hands-on" technical work
Desired Skills & Experience:
5+ years of Technical Project Management / Engagement Management
Understanding of infrastructure and cloud technologies is a must; AWS knowledge preferred- Consulting organization experience is highly preferred
Proficient in Project Scheduling and Project Lifecycle best practices
Organized and motivated team player, with the ability to manage multiple projects while paying close attention to detail
Highly responsible, self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision
Results oriented person with the ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment
Strong communicator (both verbal and written) skills are a must
Familiar with Jira, Confluence and other project management tools
Familiar with Scrum/Agile

job_description_requirements: Desired Skills & .  Experience:.  Understanding of infrastructure and cloud technologies is a must; AWS knowledge preferred- Consulting organization experience is highly preferred.  Strong communicator (both verbal and written) skills are a must

job_description:
Curai is an early stage startup with a mission to provide the world's best healthcare to everyone. We're building a patient-facing virtual care service using a unique hybrid of world class artificial intelligence combined with dedicated human practitioners to improve quality and lower the cost and friction of accessing health care.
We’re looking for an outstanding physician leader to build and oversee the clinical components of our service. The successful candidate will guide the provision of care through the creation and management of philosophies and protocols, build and maintain a high quality virtual team of providers, and coordinate with other functional heads across the company (product, machine learning, operations, engineering) to equip our providers with the tools they need to provide the highest quality care as efficiently as possible.

As a team we strive to stay curious, build a high-performance and inclusive work environment, and empower one another. These behaviors are reflected in our company values.

In this role you will:
Develop and continue to refine our philosophy of care and all underlying processes, rules and protocols
Lead a small team of physicians to educate them on our care process and identify areas to improve overall care quality.
Work together with top Machine Learning experts, engineers, and product designers to create tools and software that multiplies a physician’s reach by 10x.
In a highly technically advanced company where humans will always provide the final critical link to our patients, represent the concerns and suggestions of our physicians to the rest of the organization while also pushing the physicians to adapt to a new way of providing high quality care.
Work with other leaders at the company to help grow the team and shape processes and culture as the company grows
Help the team represent Curai and the product to the healthcare industry with the right terminology, sensibilities, credibility, and be able to understand and answer questions from doctors, clinicians, informaticians, and healthcare industry leaders.
An ideal candidate has:
Board Certification in Internal Medicine, Family Practice, or Emergency Medicine
Demonstrated experience leading physicians in a clinical context
5+ years of clinical practice, ideally significant practice in primary care or deep understanding of primary care workflows and protocols
Demonstrated experience driving innovation in a healthcare context
Proven ability to advocate on behalf of physicians across a multidisciplinary organization
Experience with telemedicine is a plus

We offer competitive compensation, and the ability to leave your footprint in the early stages of a company that will change the world. We are located in Palo Alto, in the heart of the Silicon Valley. If you’re interested, email us!
In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment at Curai.
job_description_requirements: Demonstrated experience leading physicians in a clinical context.  Demonstrated experience driving innovation in a healthcare context.  Proven ability to advocate on behalf of physicians across a multidisciplinary organization.  Experience with telemedicine is a plus

job_description:
The primary responsibility of the Area Technical Manager is to support the software sales process by creating and maintaining a technically specialized and motivated team of system engineers and solution architects with the goal of assisting the enterprise sales organization in the selling of the Information Builders solution platform i.e. data and analytics including data science and artificial intelligence.
The successful Area Technical Manager will accomplish the following:
Recruit and hire Systems Engineers (SE) and Solution Architects (SA) with deep technical expertise (subject matter experts) in the domains of data management/governance and business intelligence
Provide guidance, mentorship and coaching of team members in support of client technical engagements including (but not limited to) requirement discovery, solution presentation, solution proof of technology and overall technical solution selling and consultative services
Drive performance management and career development for team members including technical skills development and training/enablement as it relates to Information Builders solution platform and related technologies e.g. AWS/Cloud
Manage and assign technical resources in support of client sales engagements
Lead the technical team in complex client engagements e.g. architecture and functional requirements to ensure technical value selling of Information Builders solution platform
Manage the day-to-day technical activities of the assigned region/area
Support the technical team in client engagements including ability to articulate Information Builders vision and strategy, and solution platform value proposition
Engage with internal Lines of Business (LOBs) in support of field engagement and execution including (but not limited to) Strategic Services, Product Management, Product Marketing, Product Engineering and Partner/SI communities
Maintain alignment and partnership with Sales Leadership and related Account Executive teams
Key skills and competencies include the following:
Hold a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience with Business Intelligence and Data Management solutions is highly desirable
Minimum 3+ years of experience in technical leadership position
Travel required
Information Builders, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on their race, gender, disability, veteran status, or other protected classification.
job_description_requirements: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related fields.  Excellent communication and presentation skills.  Experience with Business Intelligence and Data Management solutions is highly desirable.  Minimum 3+ years of experience in technical leadership position

job_description:
At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules.

We’re looking for Business Development Manager, HPC Solutions to join the team.

Does this sound like a good role for you?
In this role you will oversee the development of strategic market business plans and marketing programs to support sales in HPC and adjacent market segments. You will identify strategic customers, develop relationships, formulate business strategy and support sales campaigns. This includes positioning the benefits of key Synopsys’ product features, IP portfolio, and Design Services as an integrated solution for HPC customers. You will be expected to know Synopsys products/services and orchestrate technical messaging for maximum impact in the HPC and adjacent markets. You will be the subject matter expert for your area of responsibility and be willing to work in a fast pace environment to deliver innovative solutions.

Responsibilities include:
Work with executives to developing the HPC and adjacent markets by being the subject matter expert on both the vertical and Synopsys’ tools and solutions that address that market.
Support sales enablement activities including but not limited to customer presentations, sales aids, roll out updates, feature releases etc. Participate in the development of account plans.
Work with Design Services team to deliver on solutions for the targeted customer segment. Coordinate inputs from the customer, sales, marketing and services teams to develop preliminary-proposals and SOWs. responsible for business development activities from client identification through to final invoicing.
Develop win-win customer relationships through active engagement and support e.g. issue resolution, communication, prioritization etc.
Serve as customer advocate in internal engineering forums with a goal to deliver high quality solutions.
May conduct make-versus-buy analysis from a partnership/merger/acquisition perspective.

Key Qualifications:
BS with 12+ years relevant experience.
MS with 10+ years relevant experience.
Related Ph.D. with 7+ years of relevant experience.
Requires a strong technical background in HPC design and verification.
Should also have sales (support) experience. Essential that the individual demonstrates strong communication and project management skills.

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

#LI-TS1

Job Category

Business Development

Hire Type

Employee

Country

United States
job_description_requirements: BS with 12+ years relevant experience.  MS with 10+ years relevant experience.  with 7+ years of relevant experience.  Should also have sales (support) experience
