job_description:
Pony.ai is a startup located in Silicon Valley and China, and our mission is to revolutionize the future of transportation by building the safest and most reliable technology for autonomous vehicles. Armed with the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence, we aim to deliver our technology on a global scale. We believe our work has the potential to transform lives and industries for the better.
At Pony.ai, excellence is at the core of our company. Every detail counts as we work to deliver a safe, reliable, and cost-effective autonomous driving platform to the public. As part of the team, you will play a critical role in developing and deploying state-of-the-art vehicle technology. You will have every opportunity to grow and develop as our company grows. Join us on this exciting journey as we bring the latest breakthroughs in artificial intelligence to the future of transportation.
We're looking for a part-time IT Administrator with solid problem-solving skills, and effectiveness in managing competing priorities. You will support staff in troubleshooting laptop, desktop, software, and hardware related issues in a timely, friendly, and collaborative manner.
As an IT Administrator (Temporary to Hire), you will:
Install, configure, and troubleshoot equipment such as; IT and office assets, laptops and desktops, computer hardware, software, systems, printers, and scanners
Basic troubleshooting and support on the office network and server environments
Help organize and maintain office server rooms, contact ISP or hardware providers for technical issues, and technical support
Set up accounts and deploy equipment for new employees
IT equipment security management and backup
Audio, video, and conferencing equipment setup and maintenance
Maintain records/logs of repairs and fixes and maintenance schedules
Experience in a Linux environment preferred
job_description_requirements: Experience in a Linux environment preferred

job_description:
Wipro’s Enterprise Operations Transformation is an aggressive driver of revenue for the organization with focus on technology and domain led transformation for the client’s business processes.
The focus is to sell domain led and technology enabled solutions which transform the way client’s business processes are managed today through design thinking, hyper-automation, right insights thereby improving the end customer experience.
The team is expanding significantly over the last couple of years and adding new solutions and emerging technologies in its umbrella of services including but not limited to Artificial Intelligence, Block Chain, IOT, BPM, Automation, Cx suite etc.
Responsible for managing the Corporate Business Services horizontal

Sales lead & Solution Architect
As a Senior Leader of Enterprise transformation within Wipro’s Digital Operations & Platform arm, you will be responsible to conceptualize, design & create technology solutions assets in order to demonstrate specific business solutions for defined region.
In depth understanding of the industry segment (ex. though not limited to Communications, Mfg, ENU) including the technologies and standards in use.
Holistic understanding of how solutions portfolios fits into client’s overall enterprise architecture and how the client can obtain value (including ROI)
Co-Develop new solutions with partners, GTM with partner to create new opportunities
You will be responsible for Sales and lead customer presentations focused on Technologies including: BPM Engine, Robotics Process Automation, Cognitive Intelligence, Analytics Engine & other BpaaS Platform
Maintain a strong pipeline by engaging with sales, pre sales and account teams across EOT solutions for your line of business
Engagement with client senior leadership focused on account mining and relationship building
Creation of a commercial construct for process transformation proposals and commercial negotiations with the customers leading up-to contract closure
Based on the roadmap anchoring the RFP response where required and supporting the detailed solution run-through
As Automation evolves into a strategic enabler convey to our customers the components of RPA & Cognition, ecosystem around RPA & Cognition (organization structure, governance model, RACI matrix, roles required, evaluation matrix for processes) and enable integration with BPM, platforms and other point solutions
Undertake process due-diligence and work as a trusted advisory to internal and external stakeholder on building an ecosystem of automation.
Building solutions with glide path across all technology levers
Evangelising solutions across domains working with multiple functions within Wipro’s digital eco system and bringing them to life in demos and innovations labs
Evaluate new technologies for the domain expertise and work with alliance teams for on-boarding
"Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law”

job_description:
About Us:
Avast is a global leader in digital security products. With over 400 million users online, we offer products under the Avast and AVG brands that protect people from threats on the internet and the evolving IoT threat landscape. Our threat detection network is among the most advanced in the world, using machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies to detect and stop threats in real time. We offer digital security products for Mobile, PC, and Mac, which are top-ranked and certified by VB100, AV-Comparatives, AV-Test, SE Labs, and others.
The position is based in North America.
About You:
As a Business Development Manager, you will drive incremental revenue by selling new solutions into new logo accounts. You will ensure the company is seen as a thought leader within the industry. In this role, you will manage all new carrier business relationships within the region and provide clear and consistent market insights back into the business unit.
Responsibilities:
Ensure all reporting is timely and accurate
Grow revenue and customer market share in line with strategic objectives and costs
Responsible for relationship management as well as complete accountability on achieving agreed revenue targets
Review and establish an understanding of competitive strategy, pricing, and growth in North America
Travel required within the US or abroad in order to achieve the proper performance for this role
Build solid, highly effective working relationships with others internally and externally
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree and 7+ years of experience in sales, preferably in the security industry
Influential with strong leadership skills
Flexible yet structured approach to problem-solving
Able to demonstrate initiative and act with integrity
Exhibit a strong level of vigor, intensity, competitiveness, and tenacity
Ability to prioritize a busy workload efficiently and work to detail
Constructively work under stress and pressure when faced with high workloads and deadlines
What we offer:
The chance to join a major global tech company
An exciting, unique product portfolio
Amazing and truly international work environment
Unlimited PTO
Competitive Bonus Program
Employee Share Matching Plan
401k Match
Medical, dental, and vision plan
HSA AND FSA
Commuter Benefit
Sounds like fun? We look forward to hearing from you!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_description:
Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

The Argo AI Software TPM team is a highly dynamic and cross-functional team. The team is responsible for the planning, technical cross-check, and plan execution of everything from lower level tasks to organizational level projects. This role will focus on supporting the different perception teams from Detection to Calibration and Localization. As a TPM, you will be responsible for leading planning and execution across multiple teams and initiatives within the Perception group to support the design, development, and optimization of new machine learning algorithms and AV software.

What you'll do:

Work with team leads, individual contributors, and other TPMs (Software and Hardware) to advance the Argo AI software products and processes
Work with perception teams to develop and optimize timing requirements, objectives, and interdependencies with activities such as, but not limited to: AV feature improvement and development, AV performance enhancements, traditional computer vision techniques and training and management of machine learning models
Develop detailed implementation plans, maintain alignment, and monitor program status across multiple activities to reduce or remove dependencies
Ensure timely delivery of deliverables and system capabilities according to an evolving, and faced-paced, program schedule
Maintain a strong technical understanding of the entirety of the program across the entire lifecycle

What we're looking for:

Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
Experience working with Machine Learning or Computer Vision techniques
Hands-on experience and strong background with modern project/software management processes and tools, e.g., agile, scrum, Jira/Rally, SmartSheets, and Google Suite
Hyper-organized mindset - able to be an influencer of projects to lead development, operations, and logistics toward a common goal
Works effectively under extreme pressure - consistently delivers excellent results and high output rates in a fast-paced environment

At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.

Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. At Argo AI, you can expect stellar perks to support your best self:

High-quality individual and family health, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan
Paid parental leave
Unlimited vacation
Daily catered lunches and snacks
Free onsite or adjacent parking
Commuter reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Professional development reimbursement

Argo AI is a LinkedIn Top 50 Startup

The candidate will target sales of our product portfolio of Business Intelligence, Advance Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and IoT, including professional services for the target organization/market. The position’s primary responsibility is to achieve new sales results for our products and services. job_description:
Position: Administrative Assistant/ Finance
Location: Eden Prairie, MN

Description
Compute North is seeking a Finance/Administrative Assistant with 2-5 years of experience to join our Finance team to help support our growth! We are looking for someone who is independent, highly detailed with proven accuracy when dealing with confidential and financial information.
Responsibilities
Financial Duties (60%)
Manage the entry and coding of invoices, check requests, and payments to ensure proper entry into the financial system.
Handle all customer and vendor correspondence related to financial matters via phone or email.
Correspond with customers and vendors to ensure updated payment information is on file and processed correctly.
Investigate and resolve problems associated with processing of invoices.
Collect and verify invoices, bills, and checks by performing pre-audits to ensure both accuracy and appropriateness prior to payment.
Reconciles various accounts in Netsuite by identifying errors in posting or omissions by applying appropriate accounting standards.
Oversee all financial documentation by maintaining files in an organized fashion for easy reference.

Administrative Duties (40%)
Assist with maintenance, tracking and collection of confidential information for the President and CEO.
Preparing documents, presentations and other materials for executive level meetings and correspondence.
Maintain high level of confidentiality and professionalism; handle assignments that may be confidential in nature and use discretion on determining who has access to such information.
Perform general administrative duties (printing, copying, collating, filing, sorting, etc), as needed.
Assist with other internal projects, as assigned.

Qualifications
2+ years Executive Admin Experience
2+ years of professional level financial experience including AP and AR a plus but not required
Proficient in Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
NetSuite experience a plus, but not required
Proven ability to clearly communicate with all levels of the organization, including C-suite
Ability to be productive in a fast-paced environment with dynamic workdays and changing prioritize
Demonstrated attention to detail, thoroughness, and ability to staying organized while dealing with highly confidential information
Independent, self-starter that can work collaboratively within a team
About Compute North
Compute North delivers high-performance blockchain, cryptocurrency mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and infrastructure solutions to customers around the globe. Led by an experienced management team with deep experience in technology, finance, and energy, the company has been on an extremely fast growth track. With build-out and operational costs at a fraction of a typical data center, Compute North is able to economically scale high-performance computing applications like blockchain and artificial intelligence. Today the company has operations in Minnesota, Texas, South Dakota, and Nebraska.

We are looking for someone who is independent, highly detailed with proven accuracy when dealing with confidential and financial information.  Experience.  2+ years of professional level financial experience including AP and AR a plus but not required.  NetSuite experience a plus, but not required. This is a unique opportunity to make a big impact, enjoy competitive compensation, manage a wide variety of projects for clients across multiple industries, and work alongside some of the best minds in the cloud services industry.
Job Summary:
The Technical Cloud Project Manager works directly with external clients managing multiple projects simultaneously. The PM's responsibilities start from the moment a project is signed and proceed until the engagement is successfully completed. The position leads clients to a successful outcome through process, resource management and financial tracking.
Manages client engagements from kickoff to delivery
Monitors project dates, tasks, hours spent, risks, blockers and customer satisfaction throughout the project life cycle
Identifies scope changes from the original plan or agreement and escalates to the management team
Works directly with Tech Leads and Directors to ensure project success
Facilitates meetings and other communication, including status reporting and meeting notes
Manages customer expectations and meets clients face to face as needed
Seeks process improvements
Reviews project hours reports for accuracy
Does not manage personnel
Does not perform any "hands-on" technical work
Desired Skills & Experience:
5+ years of Technical Project Management / Engagement Management
Understanding of infrastructure and cloud technologies is a must; AWS knowledge preferred- Consulting organization experience is highly preferred
Proficient in Project Scheduling and Project Lifecycle best practices
Organized and motivated team player, with the ability to manage multiple projects while paying close attention to detail
Highly responsible, self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision
Results oriented person with the ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment
Strong communicator (both verbal and written) skills are a must
Familiar with Jira, Confluence and other project management tools
Familiar with Scrum/Agile

job_description:
Basic Qualifications :
High School diploma or the equivalent is required. Associate’s degree in Electronics, Computer Science, Mechanical engineering is preferred. In addition, a minimum of 2 years directly related experience is required. J-STD_001, 002, IPC 610, MIL-STD-883, MIL-STD-750 and X-Ray qualification certifications may be required.


Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. That’s the opportunity that’s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced, they redefine innovation for the world. It’s an amazing challenge. And it’s waiting for you now.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


The Senior Quality Inspector will inspect parts and materials for compliance to specified requirements and perform real-time defect evaluation. This will require the preparation of QA documentation along with the verification of corrective action implementation and rework. We will rely on your strong communication skills to interface with coworkers and internal customers.


What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A High School diploma or the equivalent required; Associate’s degree in Electronics, Computer Science, Mechanical engineering preferred
Minimum of 2 years directly related experience
J-STD_001, 002, IPC 610, MIL-STD-883, MIL-STD-750 and X-Ray qualification certifications may be required
Distinct knowledge of material requirements, fabrication techniques, and manufacturability concepts
Experienced in the use of current strategic CAD tools; Pro-E/Creo or Solid Works preferred
Superior knowledge of the strategic CAD and file management tools and design documentation standards (e.g ASME Y14.5M, Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing)
Solid understanding of simple mechanical stress; structural, thermal and tolerance analysis
What sets you apart:
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Exceptional problem-solving and communication skills
Open to new ideas and serve as a champion for change when directed from management
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

job_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it!
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
Lead Enterprise Automation strategy and assure effective delivery of sustained technology development for Automation across Honeywell. You will be the primary interface to business and domain leaders to define automation roadmap, requirements and drive development execution enabled through existing and emerging tools. You will be a key member of the IT Application Quote to Cash leadership team, engaging in all aspects of running the IT, with a specialization in the use of technology to fulfill business objectives. You will provide leadership in improving IT process and developing IT team capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
 Develop IT strategy and vision around technology and development
 Provide Automation Architecture and Development Services
 Deliver Automation and Cognitive Services in areas of Process, BOTs, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
 Drive new ideas beyond traditional automation mindset and work across team to get them executed, like OCR, Integration, EDI, etc.
 Align with overall Architecture and Standards Services
 Educate business on technology around automation
 Manage IT professionals

 Bachelor's degree

 Understanding of key information technology solutions and practices

job_title_2: Strategic Alliance Development Manager - Computational Sciences
job_description:
Job no: 503178
Position Type: Staff
Location: Portland, ME Campus
Categories: Regional Campuses

About Northeastern:


Founded in 1898, Northeastern is a global research university and the recognized leader in experience-driven lifelong learning. Our world-renowned experiential approach empowers our students, faculty, alumni, and partners to create impact far beyond the confines of discipline, degree, and campus.

Our locations—in Boston; Charlotte, North Carolina; London; Portland, Maine; San Francisco; Seattle; Silicon Valley; Toronto; Vancouver; and the Massachusetts communities of Burlington and Nahant—are nodes in our growing global university system. Through this network, we expand opportunities for flexible, student-centered learning and collaborative, solutions-focused research.

Northeastern’s comprehensive array of undergraduate and graduate programs— in a variety of on-campus and online formats—lead to degrees through the doctorate in nine colleges and schools. Among these, we offer more than 195 multi-discipline majors and degrees designed to prepare students for purposeful lives and careers.


About the Opportunity:


Northeastern University invites applications for Strategic Alliance Development Manager - Computational Sciences at the Roux Institute. The Roux Institute is an engine of innovation, talent, and economic growth in Portland, the state of Maine, and the region. Industry, Academic and Government Partnerships are what sets our education and research model apart. With these leading partners, we’re together creating an agile workforce prepared to thrive in a competitive landscape powered by artificial intelligence as a force for good, and an environment for innovation in the life sciences and other high-growth sectors. This opportunity is centered on the primary goal of bringing research programs and organizations to the Roux Institute from around North America.

The Strategic Alliance Development Manager (SADM) will act as a central point of contact for the Roux Institute related to computational sciences (encompassing areas such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, data visualization, and data analytics), and will develop pathways and research partnerships and initiatives. The SADM will work in a highly self-directed mode, and in collaboration with fellow SADMs with complimentary domain expertise, both academic and operational leadership at the Roux Institute, and with professionals throughout Northeastern’s global research university system.

The SADM will help shape our research enterprise aimed at advancing the success of our partners, the regional economy, and societal capability. This will be accomplished through identification of candidate corporate, academic, government or non-profit strategic research partners, developing a progressively rich relationship targeted at mutual positive return on investment, and closing collaborative partnership agreements based on co-location and aligned strategic goals. It is expected that the research will be performed at the Roux Institute in Portland, ME, and/or within the partner company if located in (or relocated to) Maine, and leverage the Tier 1 research resources of Northeastern’s Global Research University System.


Responsibilities:


The overarching responsibilities of this position include:

Understand the specific research goals of the Roux Institute, its faculty and Partner Organizations at a level of depth that will enable identification of new collaboration opportunities in computational sciences, and other fields.
Establishes effective marketing efforts, engagement & outreach opportunities and relationship management strategies for Portland/Roux research priorities.
Identifies specific prospects to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their research and use case, and how it aligns with the Roux Institute research strategic plans.
Maintains current understanding of industry trends and developments that affect the market and Portland location.
Identify, engage, manage, and close opportunities with academic, industrial, government, and non-profit research collaborators whose interests align with and complement the research underway at the Roux Institute.
Engage, manage, and close opportunities nationwide in the area of computational sciences, particularly in applications of machine learning, artificial intelligence, data visualization, and data analytics
Collaborative engagement across a team of other disciplinary Strategic Alliance Development Managers in order to share relevant leads and identify synergistic opportunities is a must.
Meets with campus stakeholders, including faculty, research leaders, Research Development, and University Advancement, to identify research sponsorship opportunities and advise on existing relationships, valuation and packaging.
Execute the strategic research development plan devised by the Senior Vice Provost for Portland and the Directors of Research at the Roux Institute.
Prepare and give business reviews to the Institute Leadership team regarding progress and challenges to identifying, engaging, managing, and closing new partners.


Qualifications:


BS in computational sciences or a related field
8-10 years of experience in business development and/or strategic program management relating to scientific or translational research.
Ability to work effectively on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously, while maintaining a high standard of quality.
Strong interpersonal communication and political acumen skills.
Thorough analytical and written communication skills.
Thorough knowledge of sponsorships in industry, higher education, non-profits, and/or cultural institutions
A demonstrated ability to identify and leverage relevant governmental (Federal, state) funding opportunities

Preferred Qualifications

Entrepreneurial, energetic, and collaborative leadership skills. Excellent communication skills across diverse audiences and settings. A strategic mindset. Solutions oriented, problem solving mentality a must. Ability to work in a fast-paced and innovative setting. He/she must have experience working independently and as a member of a team.

There is expectation of significant travel requirements to build partner relationships and engage with Roux Institute stakeholders in Portland, ME, Boston, MA, and across the US.


Salary Grade:


 13


Additional Information:


This position will report to the Senior Vice Provost for Portland and Academic Lead for the Roux Institute and will be a member of a team of 5-6 disciplinary Strategic Alliance Development Managers. This position will work closely with research leadership at the Boston campus.

This position is not bound to a specific location; remote work and travel is therefore anticipated.

Please submit a cover letter of interest highlighting relevant professional experience, a curriculum vitae, and the names and contact information of at least three references. We will not contact references until we have discussed with our leading candidate(s).

Compensation is commensurate with qualifications, and will include a performance incentive plan.


Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.

Advertised: 29 Apr 2020 Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close:

BS in computational sciences or a related field.  8-10 years of experience in business development and/or strategic program management relating to scientific or translational research.  Ability to work effectively on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously, while maintaining a high standard of quality.  Strong interpersonal communication and political acumen skills.  Excellent communication skills across diverse audiences and settings.  Ability to work in a fast-paced and innovative setting. job_description:
Project Manager
We are seeking to fill a position of Project Manager to manage all activities for customer interface, project deployment, installation, configuration, and support of our intelligent systems. This role requires a “hands-on” PM to be able to execute project management fundamentals including, but not limited to, development of schedules, risk management, and the management of sub-contractors on and off site. The position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills for customer and executive level status reporting while also being able to technically contribute to installation, configuration and deployment of our product portfolio. This is a full-time position located in Jacksonville, FL and reports to the Vice President of Field Operations.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies incorporate artificial intelligence applications, including video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies, for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Direct and manage assigned full-scale project plans and project lifecycles from beginning to end in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Responsible for overall performance of the project team and sub-contractors, including design, procurement, construction, test, and operations
Define and document project scope, goals, and deliverables that will support business goals in collaboration with management and stakeholders
Identify, record, and mitigate risks throughout the project lifecycle
Effectively set and communicate project expectations in line with upper management and company stakeholders
Work with project team to define success criteria for project lifecycle with members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion
Effectively document and deliver progress reports to continually set and manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders
Possess the ability to manage changes in project scope, identify potential issues, and devise contingency plans
Plan, schedule, track, and communicate project timelines, milestones, and deliverables using appropriate tools
Prepare project budgets, track costs, and provide leadership reports on actual vs budget financials
Proactively manage operational KPIs to identify financial risks and develop action plan to mitigate loss
Modify budgets, project forecasting, and adapt to changes and escalate as needed
Maintain working knowledge of all Duos Technologies products and systems to be a subject matter expert
Educate and train internal departments and external customer about the products key features and service offering
Qualifications:
5-7 years of project management experience in the one of the fields below is desired:
 Commissioning of video surveillance/video analytics systems
Physical security applications
Large scale automated or heavy equipment involving subcontractors/buildouts
BS Degree in Engineering discipline preferred, or a combination of education and experience
Project management skills (development of Gantt charts, use of project management software) required
Motivated self-starter who is comfortable working alone or in a team environment
Demonstrated ability managing staff and directing project teams and sub-contractors to complete required tasks and activities
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate cross-organization and work well in a small, fast-paced team environment
Demonstrated client and vendor management skills – excellent interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability in handling, resolving, and communicating complex technical issues with customers in real-time using strong analytical and communication skills
Excel in negotiation skills/techniques with internal delivery teams or vendors to manage work execution
Solid understanding of infrastructure and IT technologies
Execute program plans by using tools identified in the planning phase and by auditing the results of their use to align the program outcomes with stakeholder expectations and standards
PMP Certification is a plus
Understanding of current environmental laws and practices is a plus
Experience in the transportation or rail/railroad industry is a plus
Bi-lingual English and Spanish is a plus
Inspires loyalty and trust, handles oneself ethically following core values
Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance; voluntary vision, critical illness, and off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.
Duos Technologies, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
Duos Technologies, Inc. is a Drug Free Workplace. An offer of employment is contingent upon satisfactory results of a pre-employment drug screening, and a background check.

Responsibilities:


The overarching responsibilities of this position include:

Understand the specific research goals of the Roux Institute, its faculty and Partner Organizations at a level of depth that will enable identification of new collaboration opportunities in computational sciences, and other fields.
Establishes effective marketing efforts, engagement & outreach opportunities and relationship management strategies for Portland/Roux research priorities.
Identifies specific prospects to approach while communicating the specific value proposition for their research and use case, and how it aligns with the Roux Institute research strategic plans.
Maintains current understanding of industry trends and developments that affect the market and Portland location.
Identify, engage, manage, and close opportunities with academic, industrial, government, and non-profit research collaborators whose interests align with and complement the research underway at the Roux Institute.
Engage, manage, and close opportunities nationwide in the broad area of biomedical engineering as described above.
Collaborative engagement across a team of other disciplinary Strategic Alliance Development Managers in order to share relevant leads and identify synergistic opportunities is a must.
Meets with campus stakeholders, including faculty, research leaders, Research Development, and University Advancement, to identify research sponsorship opportunities and advise on existing relationships, valuation and packaging.
Execute the strategic research development plan devised by the Senior Vice Provost for Portland and the Directors of Research at the Roux Institute.
Prepare and give business reviews to the Institute Leadership team regarding progress and challenges to identifying, engaging, managing, and closing new partners.


Qualifications:


BS in engineering or a related field
8-10 years of experience in business development and/or strategic program management relating to scientific or translational research.
Ability to work effectively on multiple projects and priorities simultaneously, while maintaining a high standard of quality.
Strong interpersonal communication and political acumen skills.
Thorough analytical and written communication skills.
Thorough knowledge of sponsorships in industry, higher education, non-profits, and/or cultural institutions
A demonstrated ability to identify and leverage relevant governmental (Federal, state) funding opportunities

Preferred Qualifications

Entrepreneurial, energetic, and collaborative leadership skills. Excellent communication skills across diverse audiences and settings. A strategic mindset. Solutions oriented, problem solving mentality a must. Ability to work in a fast-paced and innovative setting. He/she must have experience working independently and as a member of a team.

There is expectation of significant travel requirements to build partner relationships and engage with Roux Institute stakeholders in Portland, ME, Boston, MA, and across the US.


Salary Grade:


 13


Additional Information:


This position will report to the Senior Vice Provost for Portland and Academic Lead for the Roux Institute and will be a member of a team of 5-6 disciplinary Strategic Alliance Development Managers. This position will work closely with research leadership at the Boston campus.

This position is not bound to a specific location; remote work and travel is therefore anticipated.

Please submit a cover letter of interest highlighting relevant professional experience, a curriculum vitae, and the names and contact information of at least three references. We will not contact references until we have discussed with our leading candidate(s).

Compensation is commensurate with qualifications, and will include a performance incentive plan.



Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.

Advertised: 29 Apr 2020 Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close:

job_description:
Description:
Dagostino Electronic Services is seeking an individual to fill the Role of Chief Innovation Officer. A strong background in technology is a necessity for this position and for that reason, an emphasis in the following is required:


Artificial Intelligence
Machine Learning
Cognitive Computing

The Chief Innovation Officer is a strategic innovation veteran with a career spanning corporate and/or consulting environments. Experienced in all facets of strategy, solution design, product development and business growth through innovation, she/he is a seasoned leader who has cultivated teams across multiple industry disciplines and managed teams in large international companies. The executive is responsible for defining and fostering a culture of innovation across the overall company that fosters and attracts successful innovators and entrepreneurs. Excellent interpersonal skills that drive unified strategies and products. Data driven decision maker; able to bring order to chaos and drive large, highly complex initiatives. Coach and mentor, empowering teams to learn and perform at their highest potential while embracing diversity in thinking. She/he is the ultimate growth hacker through innovation.

Requirements:
RESPONSIBILITIES

Drive New Growth Opportunities

Identify, develop and execute high-impact innovation strategy and road map aligned to strategic business goals and growth priorities.
Manage a balanced portfolio of growth projects that span sustaining and disruptive initiatives focused on product, service, process, and business model innovation.
Work closely with the business teams and product development to create viable business models and commercialization strategies for mature innovations.
Promote the company’s innovation agenda; influence and foster the culture between individuals and departments

Build and Grow Innovation Capabilities

Develop and maintain strong ties with teams; educate and train teams on new solutions and innovations; drive innovation, presentations and innovation sessions.
Act as the Innovation champion for the entire organization. Promote company-wide participation in creation and protection for standard practices. Educate and provide necessary support for new innovators in the company and lead by example.
Ensure timely, successful commercialization of innovation initiatives.
Track and report on innovation metrics and business impact on a regular basis.

Champion Innovation

Establish Dagostino Electronic Services as a recognized innovation leader among customer and industry groups to build brand and attract and retain talent.
Identify external assets and companies that may accelerate innovation and market access through partnerships and acquisitions

Experience

15+ years of relevant experience in innovation, technology and/or solutions development. 5+ years executive of a large company.
Deep understanding of significant aspects of technologies, business models, and regulations relevant for the industry.
Demonstrated success in defining a culture of innovation and driving dramatic growth through new revenue sources.
M.S./MBA/Ph.D. or equivalent operational experience.

Expected Outcomes of Role

A clear innovation strategy for Dagostino Electronic Services and its Customers.
Innovation strategy is understood and endorsed by key stakeholders including executive leadership, customers and innovation team members.
A well-balanced innovation portfolio and roadmap exists that drives investments & top line growth.
Innovation portfolio and roadmap are aligned with the innovation strategy and support the business direction, goals and priorities.
Innovation portfolio can be clearly linked to commercial benefits and drives significant new revenue and profit.
Ensure that Dagostino Electronic Services is successful in taking its innovations to market in a timely and scalable manner.
Innovations to differentiate Dagostino Electronic Services in the marketplace, provide unique value to customers and help build long-term relationships with customers.
Dagostino Electronic Services is seen as innovative, visionary and a leader internally and by customers, industry groups and media.
Dagostino Electronic Services has a thriving innovation culture that nurtures and promotes ideas from across the organization.

Requirements: Physical demands and work environment:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Travel to customer sites as needed
While performing duties of this job, Employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts
Employee may be required to lift, pull, push, and carry up to 50 pounds
Incumbent will be required to use a computer with a keyboard, telephone or handheld mobile device for extended periods of time, and office machinery as needed

Workdays and Shifts:
Position works Monday-Friday, daylight hours, and additional time as needed to complete work

We offer a full compensation and benefits structure. Join the team that is the Preferred Technology Provider for the Pittsburgh Steelers, and winner of numerous Customer Satisfaction and Top Work Place awards.

EOE

Job Type: Full-time

Excellent interpersonal skills that drive unified strategies and products.  Experience.  15+ years of relevant experience in innovation, technology and/or solutions development.  or equivalent operational experience

job_description:
Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as :
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.
Logistics and Location
We are hiring for Berkeley Heights, NJ
U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Flexibility to travel and/or relocate within the US as per project requirements.

job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI Information Systems is in search of an Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM) to support the Air National Guard Reserve Order Writing System (AROWS) as part of the Application Development and Support Contract with the Air National Guard.

Responsibilities:

Assist the ANG Information Technology Portfolio Management (IT PfM) Action Officer with reporting on the cost and effectiveness of AROWS to ensure strategic alignment with the DoD Enterprise Architecture. Using the Information Technology Investment Portfolio System (ITIPS) to submit AROWS IT Budget data required to support OMB Circular A-11 requirements, e-Government reviews, OMB Circular A-130, “Management of Federal Information Resources”, budget analysis, special data calls, and Congressional displays.
Assist in the development of Technical, Financial, and Certification Documentation to ensure AROWS remains compliant with the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA), the Chief Financial Officer’s (CFO) Act, and Privacy and Records Management Requirements. This includes development of Fiscal Year Budget Estimate Submissions, Organization Execution Plan (OEP) Funding Verification Memos, and OEP Out of Cycle (OOC) Funding Requests. Draft response to data validation inquiries submitted by the Headquarters Air Force Human Resource Management Portfolio Managers.
Conduct annual review of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) Information Assurance Package to ensure AROWS maintains an Authority to Operate (ATO). Update artifacts and information within the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) to validate Security Controls and Assessments. Develop Plan of Actions and Milestones (POAMs) for non-compliant items.
Support NGB/A1 in response to taskers and data calls regarding the health and Return on Investment (ROI) of AROWS.
Support efforts in response to DoD and Air Force Audits regarding AROWS and AROWS related data. Participate in Audit Planning, Audit Walk-throughs, assembly of Prepared By Client (PBC) Artifacts, discussions on Notice of Findings and Recommendations (NFRs), and development of Corrective Action Plans (CAPs).
Qualifications:
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Information Assurance Management, Computer Science, or related field. (May be substituted for relevant work experience).
IAM Level II Certification, or higher (CAP, CASP, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), GSLC)).
Working knowledge of the Risk Management Framework (RMF) process and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publications (specifically NIST 800-53 and NIST 800-37).
10 - 15 years experience

Preferred Education and Experience:
Working knowledge of DoD and USAF Audit processes and information systems.
Working knowledge of DoD and USAF Portfolio Management processes and information systems.
Ability to manage the Plan of Actions & Milestones (POA&M) documents associated with Information Systems.
Excellent writing, verbal communication, and time-management skills.
Must possess or be able to obtain a Secret Security Clearance.

Physical Requirements:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl as required
It is the policy of NCI to provide equal opportunity in recruiting, hiring, training, and promoting individuals in all job categories without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected class or category as may be defined by federal, state, or local laws or regulations. In addition, we affirm that all compensation, benefits, company-sponsored training, educational assistance, social, and recreational programs are administered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. It is our firm intent to support equal employment opportunity and affirmative action in keeping with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. NCI is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

Excellent writing, verbal communication, and time-management skills.  Must possess or be able to obtain a Secret Security Clearance

job_description:
Software Architect / Development Lead - Chicago


Company Description

RedMane Technology LLC is an application software consulting and systems integration company based in Chicago. We deliver software solutions for our clients throughout the United States and Canada by means of building new applications, implementing cloud and packaged systems, and/or modernizing legacy systems.

RedMane has earned an exemplary service reputation. Our primary objective is to ensure the solutions we design and implement meet or exceed the needs of our clients for their mission critical systems.

We are a problem-solving company. Technology is just our tool.

The Role

The Software Architect / Development Lead is a hands-on role responsible for architecting and driving the development our low code, highly configurable SaaS product. This product incorporates leading-edge technologies, from cloud-based mobility to data visualizations and artificial intelligence. This role involves close coordination with the product owner and other key members of the product development organization.

Day to Day Activities Include

Envisioning and architecting innovative solutions for complex problems, leveraging advanced understanding of software engineering principles.

Leading technical product design sessions, prototype work, and proofs-of-concept.

Hands-on analysis, design, and development to enable further product scalability and interoperability.

Leading an engineering team of developers in an Agile Scrum environment.

Working with the product owner to remove obstacles, review design, and ensure releases meets the needs of stakeholders.

Mentoring team members in design, coding practices, and software development policies and guidelines.

Actively contributing to software development design and coding standards.

Verifying all completed work follows best practices and engineering standards.

Supporting cross-functional teams in testing, deploying, and implementing the product.

Monitoring and evaluating industry trends and third-party tools.

Preferred Qualifications

8+ years of experience in software development as a full stack developer.

2+ years of engineering leadership experience, preferably in a C#, .NET, and SQL Server environment.

2+ architecting application, product, and/or platform solutions, preferably in a cloud/Azure environment.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to individuals with varying levels of technical understanding.

Highly self-motivated with the ability to work independently.

Proven ability to efficiently learn and apply new ideas and concepts.

Ability to organize time, staff, and projects efficiently.

Required Qualifications

All professionals at RedMane are expected to possess these skills:

A strong ethical foundation, capable of thriving in an environment and culture where honesty, integrity, and accountability are core values.

A collaborative spirit, a team orientation, and a willingness and desire to contribute to the success of others.

We Offer You

RedMane has a great working environment, offering challenging and interesting work, a place where you can have fun and express your talent and creativity. A chance to make a significant contribution that will be recognized and valued. You will be working side by side with like-minded peers in a non-bureaucratic environment where sharing knowledge is the norm.

We believe you should have fun and enjoy growing your career; we provide the supportive and empowering environment to make it happen.

Market based compensation with a full range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), short and long-term disability insurance, etc.

job_description:
ROLE
We need an experienced energy-oriented Project Manager to lead a 4-person team. You'll lead initiatives to help the US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) implement business processes, polices, and guidance in relation to their Hydropower Program's Strategic Plan.
As context, the USACE Headquarters Hydropower Program provides budget and policy oversight and guidance to the 75 USACE Federal Hydropower projects. In July 2019, the Headquarters Hydropower Program completed its Strategic Plan; highlighting goals, objectives, and actions needed to enable data-driven performance analyses in order to ensure hydropower assets are available to provide reliable renewable energy and flexible capacity to our nation's electric grid.
This is a full-time opportunity. We can offer long-term job security and stability, competitive pay, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Apply today!

RESPONSIBILITIES
Help the USACE Headquarters Hydropower Program clarify and develop national policies, regulations, and guidance
Perform business research and analysis relating to the USACE Federal Hydropower Program performance
Assist the USACE Hydropower Program with consistent decision support framework for a variety of tasks related to both the operation and maintenance of USACE hydropower equipment
Provide structured scoping assistance to enable USACE to develop future work requirements
Provide professional reports, documentation, and presentations, as necessary
Provide technical advice related to the integration of hydropower data into programmatic business practices
Assist in scoping efforts for future data aggregation and visualization
Provide market research related to generation utility digital transformation
Demonstrate big data and artificial intelligence tools for hydropower operational data
Assist in pilot project demonstrations for incorporating and using large data set analysis
Assist USACE Hydropower Program in evaluating future operations and business practices to accommodate potential future market changes
Conduct market and business research enabling a better understanding of electricity market and electric generation industry
Provide regional and national level support in adapting to specific market changes
Assist with Power Marketing Administration and Federal Hydropower Customer engagement on market changes
Support and/lead meetings
Facilitate and/or support facilitation of both formal and informal meetings
Coordinate logistics, e.g., teleconference, webinar hosting, meeting invitations, etc.
Deliver meeting minutes and notes
Assist in National level reporting requirements
Interface with senior military officers, executives, and managers
Serve as the primary source and aggregator of knowledge
Lead and/or support essential project management and oversight activities
Lead and/or support management of project cost, schedule, and scope

BACKGROUND
15+ years of progressive and relevant experience
Experience in change management and strategic planning
Experience with data analytics and data science
Experience with electric utility and generation
Experience with hydropower generation
Experience with wholesale electricity marketing

EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree

JOB LOCATION
100% telework during COVID-19
Washington, DC area

RELOCATION
Relocation may be offered to candidates living more than 50 miles away

West 4th Strategy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action (EEO/AA) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, ancestry, national origin, age, marital status, mental disability, physical disability, medical condition, pregnancy, political affiliation, military or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by federal or state law.

Other Considerations: This position is W-2 only; no Corp-to-Corp or 1099 candidates. Relocation may be offered for candidates living more than 50 miles away. Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation. Individual's primary workstation is located in an office area. The noise level in this environment is low to moderate. Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of the time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc. Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of the time.

job_description:
We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our Analyse, Secure and Transport products within the United Kingdom (UK). Products that extract insights, protect and dynamically share our critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) civilian and military leadership, the UK Intelligence Community and the United States (US) Department of Defence (DoD) to understand the core customer needs and to bring a product to market.

This position is located in London, and involves some travel within the UK and internationally. An ability to hold a UK national security clearance is preferred, but not required.
We are looking for a track record that will include the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases,
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end userBalancing customer needs with engineering constraints,
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the businessDefining and exceeding success metrics with the products you buildInspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority,
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design),
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally,
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teamsExperience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.
You might be a good fit if you:
Have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the UK, the US and its allies from adversaries,
Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,
Are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition.
As the senior product manager in the UK, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision across each of our product areas. You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. job_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it!
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Are you ready to help us make the future?
Lead Enterprise Automation strategy and assure effective delivery of sustained technology development for Automation across Honeywell. job_description:
Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI: As the Program Manager/Site Lead you will support the Global Enterprise Fabric (GEF) Operations and Maintenance contract. GEF falls under NETCOM Army Enterprise’s DoDIN operations and services provider, executing full-spectrum cyber operations and attaining information superiority, and achieving an integrated network enterprise across the Joint, Interagency, Intergovernmental, and Multinational (JIIM) domains. NETCOM plans, engineers, installs, integrates, operates, protects, and sustains Army Cyberspace, enabling Mission Command through all phases of unified action operations with all mission partners across the JIIM domains. NETCOM is the single authority assigned to operate, manage, and defend the Army’s “InfoStructure” at the enterprise level and the single authority for any standard, system, architecture, design, or device that impacts the Army Enterprise Infostructure. NCI will support all NETCOM managed Army DoDIN enclaves including NIPR, SIPR, Coalition Network Combined Enterprise Regional Information Exchange System (CENTRIX) –Korea (CX-K), Mobilization and Force Generation Installation (MFGI) Mission Partner Environment (MPE), and tactical network integrations. NCI will provide services defined in the contract, including capability management, project integration, process development, Information Assurance (IA), cybersecurity, configuration management (CM), hardware/software support, as well as support functions such as database policy definition, requirements development and management and technical writing.
Program Manager/Site Lead
Support the Government in planning, coordinating, and managing tasks, including project management, administration, work schedules, quality assurance, and control of the requirements.
Coordinate, manage and assess urgency and status of requirements to determine, coordinate and execute the next steps in problem evaluation and resolution.
Coordinate with the COR/GTL/GTM to report case analysis, resolution, and closure and to provide trend analysis and future requirements planning.
Monitor performance against the tasks on the contract and provide weekly and monthly status reports to the COR that shall include task, problem resolution status and performance.
Participate in In- Progress reviews (IPR), project meetings, technical meetings, and periodic video/teleconferences to provide the Government a status on progress and accomplishments on tasks, schedule, and other issues.
Qualifications:
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience: BA 10 - 15 years
Clearance: Secret
IA Certification: IAT-I, at least one of the following (A+ CE, CCNA-Security, CND, Network+ CE, SSCP)
CE Certification: PMP or MCSA or CCNA or VCP or equivalent
PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification strongly desired
ITIL Foundations or ITIL Intermediate
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:
Sitting for long periods
Standing for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings
Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl as required
Travel by land or air transportation 10%

job_description:
10+ Years of experience and knowledge within the startup ecosystem in an operator role or as an advisor and/or investor10+ years of business development or program / product management experience in an Enterprise, SMB, or startup5+ years of managing teams in a dynamic, fast paced environment

The AWS early stage startup team works directly with many of the top startups in the world. You will spend your days interfacing with global startup organization leadership teams, working with early stage startup founders, and navigating cross-AWS and Amazon to enable startups to realize outsized success. The team’s comprised of a rare group of high-caliber founders, working within Amazon to drive AWS strategy and support the next generation of startup entrepreneurs.

You might never have thought of working at AWS – but this is a unique role to work for one of the fastest growing startups of all time (AWS, believe it or not) while being plugged into the center of the startup ecosystem. We’re hiring for roles across the US and seeking team members who have founded companies, and who get excited about working with and mentoring early stage startup founders day-in and day-out.

If this role sounds interesting, read on:

Candidates must have a background as a startup founder, early employee or investor, where they’ve built a business, likely raised capital, and experienced the arc of business-building from nothing to something.

Candidates will posses both a business and technical background – a business background to enable the candidate to drive engagement with leading startup accelerators, and technical exposure to enable the candidate to easily interact with startup founders, engineers, and builders.

Top candidates will have worked in a structured and rigorous environment, whether in a corporate culture (e.g. Amazon, Google, Facebook), later-stage startup environment (e.g. reporting to a Board of Directors), investment banking, and/or consulting. The candidate must have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, convey compelling data-driven decisions, and work collaboratively to build consensus.

A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must, as is the ability to leverage and motivate Amazon and AWS’ global organization to achieve results.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping drive overall AWS market and technical strategy.Manage teams focused on working with partners to engage and help early stage startupsExecute strategic initiatives for AWS, while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales teams, partners, marketing, support, etc.).Work closely with startup organizations and portfolio companies to ensure they are successful using the AWS platform, by providing technical resources and business mentorship programs.Understand and actively utilize salesforce.com and other internal Amazon systems, to manage reporting, tracking, and goal attainment for the early stage startup team.Prepare and deliver data-driven reviews to the senior management about progress, achievements, and roadblocks in the early stage startup business.Serve as the primary eyes and ears for AWS and Amazon to the startup community.Handle a high volume of engagements and the fast pace of the cloud computing market.Some relevant technical knowledge required, such as: fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, database systems, core distributed computing concepts, content delivery networks (CDNs), artificial intelligence / machine learning, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied AWS services.Some travel required.

Relevant technical knowledge, such as: fundamentals of cloud computing and virtualization, storage systems, database systems, core distributed computing concepts, content delivery networks (CDNs), artificial intelligence / machine learning, etc. with ability to go deep enough on technical aspects to differentiate between varied AWS services.MBA or equivalent executive level experience.
This position may be located virtually however there is a preference to be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp..offices with a preference for The Bay Area

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age.

Candidates must have a background as a startup founder, early employee or investor, where theyve built a business, likely raised capital, and experienced the arc of business-building from nothing to something.
